par.text: Thulium is a silvery-grey metal, soft enough to be cut with a knife. It belongs to the lanthanide series. A reactive element, thulium combines with oxygen from air to form thulium oxide - T
; also reatcs with the halogens, phosphorus and carbon. The products of the reaction with water are thulium hydroxide - Tm(OH

- and hydrogen; in the reaction with acids, salts and hydrogen are formed. Compounds of thulium are usually greenish-coloured. Thulium was discovered in 1879 by a Swedish chemist Per Teodor Cleve. The name of the element is derived from the Latin word
